biography.value: The most cunning and treacherous of true dragons, green dragons use misdirection and trickery to get the upper hand against their enemies. A green dragon is recognized by the crest that begins near its eyes and continues down its spine, reaching full height just behind the skull.

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=poison average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 16 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales poisonous gas in a 60-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 18 format=long]], taking [[/damage 16d6 type=poison average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The forest-loving green dragons sometimes compete for territory with black dragons in marshy woods and with white dragons in subarctic taiga. However, a forest controlled by a green &Reference[dragon]{dragon} is easy to spot. A perpetual fog hangs in the air in a legendary green dragon’s wood, carrying an acrid whiff of the creature’s &Reference[poison]{poison} breath. The moss-covered trees grow close together except where winding pathways trace their way like a maze into the heart of the forest. The light that reaches the forest floor carries an emerald green cast, and every sound seems muffled.

At the center of its forest, a green &Reference[dragon]{dragon} chooses a cave in a sheer cliff or hillside for its lair, preferring an entrance hidden from prying eyes. Some seek out cave mouths concealed behind waterfalls, or partly submerged caverns that can be accessed through lakes or streams. Others conceal the entrances to their lairs with vegetation.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Grasping roots and vines erupt in a 20-foot radius centered on a point on the ground that the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. That area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature there must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the roots and vines. A creature can be freed if it or another creature takes an action to make a DC 15 &Reference[str]{Strength} check and succeeds. The roots and vines wilt away when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses this lair action again or when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies.
  • A wall of tangled brush bristling with thorns springs into existence on a solid surface within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, and it blocks &Reference[line]{line} of sight. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]]. A creature that fails the save takes [[/damage 4d8 type=piercing average=true]] damage and is pushed 5 feet out of the wall’s space, appearing on whichever side of the wall it wants. A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, a creature in the wall’s space must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] once each round it’s in contact with the wall, taking [[/damage 4d8 type=piercing average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, resistance to &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} and &Reference[piercing]{piercing} damage, and immunity to &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage. The wall sinks back into the ground when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses this lair action again or when the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies.
  • Magical fog billows around one creature the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} until initiative count 20 on the next round.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary green dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Thickets form labyrinthine passages within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair. The thickets act as 10-foot-high, 10-foot-thick walls that block &Reference[line]{line} of sight. Creatures can move through the thickets, with every 1 foot a creature moves costing it 4 feet of movement. A creature in the thickets must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] once each round it’s in contact with the thickets or take [[/damage 1d6 type=piercing average=true]] damage from thorns.
    Each 10-foot-cube of thickets has AC 5, 30 hit points, resistance to &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} and &Reference[piercing]{piercing} damage, vulnerability to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, and immunity to &Reference[psychic]{psychic} and &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage.
  • Within 1 mile of its lair, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} leaves no physical evidence of its passage unless it wishes to. Tracking it there is impossible except by magical means. In addition, it ignores movement impediments and damage from plants in this area that are neither magical nor creatures, including the thickets described above. The plants remove themselves from the dragon’s path.
  • Rodents and birds within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair serve as the dragon’s eyes and ears. Deer and other large game are strangely absent, hinting at the presence of an unnaturally hungry predator.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, the rodents and birds lose their supernatural link to it. The thickets remain, but within 1d10 days, they become mundane plants and normal difficult terrain, losing their thorns.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 19 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 19 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
